title: Bank of England pledges to keep pace with US on stablecoin regulations
summary: The UK’s top bank says it will roll out stablecoin rules “just as quickly as the US” amid concerns that it's lagging behind global allies.

title: Franklin Templeton brings tokenized USD money market fund to Hong Kong
summary: The launch marks Franklin Templeton’s latest step into digital assets, introducing a blockchain-based UCITS fund as Hong Kong accelerates its push toward real-world asset tokenization.

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
summary: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

title: UK ruling in Getty Images' AI lawsuit leaves key IP questions unanswered
summary: The mixed ruling was claimed as a victory by both Stability AI and Getty Images, muddying the legal waters around AI and intellectual property.

title: US lawmakers to meet with Trump’s crypto czar, discuss bill: Report
summary: Some experts suggest that the US Senate is more likely to pass a funding bill to reopen the government before any crypto legislation.

title: CMT Digital secures $136M to back next wave of blockchain startups
summary: The Chicago-based crypto venture company has already invested part of its new $136 million fund in stablecoin startups, as blockchain VC activity slows in 2025.

title: Circle changes policy, allows users to buy certain weapons with USDC
summary: The company updated its terms to prohibit the purchase or sale of weapons “in contravention of applicable laws,” suggesting that legally permissible transactions were possible.

title: Balancer releases preliminary post-mortem report after $116M hack
summary: The hack was one of the “most sophisticated” attacks so far in 2025, according to Deddy Lavid, CEO of blockchain security company Cyvers.

title: ETH price drop to $3K sets stage for $7B short squeeze if crypto market recovery holds
summary: ETH’s flash crash to $3,050 cleared out $1.3 billion in leveraged long positions, creating a market imbalance with $7 billion in short liquidity. Will a short squeeze send ETH above $4,000?

title: Self-custody meets KYC: Tangem launches Visa payments with Paera
summary: Tangem Pay enables users to spend Circle’s USDC stablecoin worldwide through a virtual Visa card that connects directly to Tangem’s self-custodial hardware wallet.
